info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 9:32PM CDT until April 10 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana...
Bogue Chitto River Near Bush affecting St. Tammany Parish.
For the Bogue Chitto River...including Tylertown, Franklinton, Bush...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Bogue Chitto River near Bush.
* WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon to early Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, The access road upstream of the bridge will flood. The river will leave the main channel on the left bank below the bridge flooding woodlands on either side of Louisiana Highway 21.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CDT Monday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 11.5 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 145 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING
